UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Ancient antimicrobial peptides kill antibiotic-resistant pathogens: Australian mammals provide new options.
Literature.Author: Wang J, Wong ES, Whitley JC, Li J, Stringer JM, Short KR, Renfree MB, Belov K, Cocks BG

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli DH5alpha(MIC=1.46µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028(MIC=1.58µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=1.29µM),Bacillus subtilis(MIC=2.14µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=1.39µM),Streptococcus pyogenes ATCC 19615(MIC=0.39µM),Streptococcus uberis(MIC=0.63µM),Candida albicans ATCC 753(MIC=1.47µM)
